query: What duty of care, if any, did Gulfstream owe regarding its estimates?
output:
CLAUDE CODE ANALYSIS
Query: What duty of care, if any, did Gulfstream owe regarding its estimates?

RELEVANT DOCUMENT EXCERPTS:

[2. Craig Kleebe - Cross Exam & Impeachment.docx, p.1]
Isn’t that a breach of Gulfstream’s duty to provide honest and informed quoting to its customers?

[Opening Statement.docx, p.1]
Breach of Contract / Duty of Care:

[Danny Farnham Direct Outline with Cross & Redirect.docx, p.1]
MROs have no duty to estimate discrepancies | Standard industry proposals include ROMs for discrepancy costs

[NO exhibits - CITIOM EXPERT REPORT - D. Farnham Expert Report - Mar 21 2025 copy.pdf, p.10]
Duty to Set Realistic Expectations: MRO providers have a professional duty to set realistic

[NO exhibits - CITIOM EXPERT REPORT - D. Farnham Expert Report - Mar 21 2025 copy.pdf, p.10]
underestimate costs and downtime are a breach of this duty.

[Claimant CITIOM Pre-Hearing Brief - Apr 14 2025 (1).pdf, p.12]
S.E.2d 596 (2015); O.C.G.A. § 24-14-22. The duty to preserve is not limited to formal notice of

[CITIOM Statement of Claim.pdf, p.4]
understanding of the current industry situation as to not misinform or forfeit a duty of care to its

[2. Danny Farnham Direct Outline with Cross & Redirect.docx, p.1]
Did Gulfstream’s quote and conduct meet the duty of care owed to its customer?

[Bassim Draft Witness Statement.docx, p.1]
Gulfstream attempted to justify the delays and cost overruns by blaming unexpected corrosion findings and suggesting issues with the Aircraft's maintenance history or storage. I reject these excuses. As stated earlier, the Aircraft was well-maintained by Avcon, based at Farnborough (not a high-corrosion environment), washed regularly, and flown frequently (approx. 700 hours/year). Furthermore, Gulfstream, as the OEM with access to its own historical data and the specific maintenance history of this Aircraft (including the 144-month inspection and July 2023 work), should have anticipated the potential for corrosion and provided a realistic estimate from the outset. Their failure to do so, especially after introducing their new data analytics tool, constitutes a breach of their duty of care.

[Charles Philipp Outline #1.docx, p.1]
As SCC, didn’t you have a duty to flag unrealistic estimates based on known internal performance data?

[464-544.pdf, p.3]
message has been prepared and sent with the greatest possible care, including scanning for viruses. In spite of this, we assume no liability



Based on document search, key findings:
- Found relevant excerpts in repository documents
- See excerpts above for specific citations
